Text: In the LORD I take refuge. How then can you say to me, ”Flee to your mountain like a bird“?
Context: David expresses his trust in the LORD amidst advice to flee from danger.

Text: For behold, the wicked bend their bows; they set their arrow on the string to shoot from the shadows at the upright in heart.
Context: David describes the preparations of the wicked to attack the righteous.

Text: If the foundations are destroyed, what can the righteous do?”
Context: David reflects on the potential collapse of moral and social order.

Text: The LORD is in His holy temple; the LORD’s throne is in heaven. His eyes watch; His eyelids test the sons of men.
Context: Despite the wicked‘s actions, David affirms God’s sovereign rule and watchful presence.

Text: The LORD examines the righteous and the wicked; He hates the lover of violence.
Context: David speaks of God‘s judgment, discerning between the righteous and the wicked.

Text: Upon the wicked He will rain down fiery coals and sulfur; a scorching wind will be their portion.
Context: David describes God’s fierce judgment upon the wicked.

Text: For the LORD is righteous, He loves justice; the upright will see His face.
Context: David concludes with the assurance of God‘s righteousness and the promise that the upright will behold God.
